page.title: 15REDRUTH SUMMER FAIR
page.content: Every summer the fair visits Redruth. They visit 28 different places every year.The furthest away is at Bristol.They only travel from Easter to November.In winter they repair, maintain and decorate the equipment.There are 17 rides and 60 different games.The hardest of these to put up is the Dodgems. All rides are tested before the fair opens, but the owner is not afraid of any serious accidents.300 to 400 people work for the fair. The shortest time they have taken to dismantle the fair is 4 hours.They greatly enjoy living in caravans, and travelling from one place to another.Many of the people have been with the fair all their life. Some of them have a permanent home which they use when the fair is closed in Winter.The deVey family own this particular fair.
